result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip L. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CONSECUTIVE to 14CF14 and concurrent to 14CF1191 & 11CF1017
**AMENDED TO READ - CONSECUTIVE TO 04CF714 NOT 14CF14 **

superMiscConds.notes: DOC to determine restitution for remaining victims

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay resitution plus surcharges; the State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not have contact with victims or places of business, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP consecutive to 14CF714 and concurrent to 14CF1191 and 11CF1017; 3 years initial confinement; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is elgible for SAP, deft is not eligible for CIP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; restitution to be determined for remaining victims.   (NOTE:  4/28/15 the sentence is consecutive to 04CF714, not 14CF714. hb)

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Due to an issue with whether probation in file 97CF185 is running and should have been revoked the SEH is adjourned to 4/22/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 4/2/15 at 10am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Rose and ADA Delgado the FPT of 1/30/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as the deft could not be writted in time; reset to 2/16/15 at 3:30pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause.  Arraignment held.  State files information.  Atty Rose acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  Court finds that the deft is competent to proceed.  DA PTC 1/16/15 at 1:30pm and FPT 1/30/15 at 8:30am.  Atty Rose's motion to modify bond is denied.
